DOUTORADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Effects of vitamin E-enriched foods on the lipids of human plasma and pork meat

POS-DOUTORADO.NOME-AGENCIA: Marie Curie Industry-Academia Partnerships and Pathways - Carbosorb

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
Marie Curie IAPP european project (Post-doc)
Carbosorb is a 4 year, 1.28 million Euro FP7 IAPP (Industry Academia Partnerships & Pathways) project, coordinated by the University of Brighton. The aim of Carbosorb is to develop and manufacture permeable composite filters in which carbon-rich nanoparticles (or nanoporous materials) will be embedded (and contained in a recyclable 3D structure), and use these as the basis of recyclable, high-performance water clean-up devices, for application in environmental and industrial sectors. It brings together a multidisciplinary consortium of specialists in different areas of environmental (geo)chemistry, nanotechnology and physical, analytical, synthetic, polymer and surface chemistry, working with a common aim of developing new and efficient methods of contaminant removal from surface and groundwaters, drinking waters and trade and industrial effluent.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Establishment of methodology based on GC-MS and LC-MS for the analysis of emerging contaminants and evaluation of the efficiency and selectivity of carbon (nano)particles composites in removing emerging organic contaminants from environmental samples
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Establishment of methodology based on GC-MS/MS and LC-MS/MS for the analysis of emerging contaminants (estrogens and steroidal hormones) in wastewater effluents and surface waters. Another stream of research focuses on the evaluation of the efficiency and selectivity of carbon (nano)particles composites in removing emerging organic contaminants from environmental samples. Quantitative and qualitative LC/MS/MS studies are performed using different ionization methods (ESI, H-ESI, APCI, APPI, APPI/APCI, APPI/ESI) combined with different types of mass analyzers (triple quadrupole, single quadrupole, ion trap).

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Study of the foods fortification with health-promoting additives like ω3 fatty acids and antioxidants (CoQ10 and tocopherol) enriched-products
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Chemical characterization of the functional foods (e.g enriched with antioxidants, sterols, fatty acids ω3, conjugated linoleic and linolenic acids) and evaluation of their health-promoting and/or disease-preventing property through the study of the existing interaction among biologically active molecules and the onset of pathologies. Development of a novel method for the simultaneous characterization of glycolipids (GLs) and phospholipids (PLs) molecular species by means of high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) coupled online with ion-trap mass spectrometry of second order (MS MS).

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Quality improvement and characterization of volatile compounds in beer by means of comprehensive 2D-gaschromatography mass spectrometry
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Quality improvement and characterization of volatile compounds in beer by means of comprehensive 2D-gaschromatography mass spectrometry

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Characterization of the glyco- and phospholipid molecular species by means of normal-phase high performance liquid chromatography coupled on-line with electrospray ionization ion-trap mass spectrometry (HPLC-ESI-MS-MS)
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: The goal of the research is to point out the parameters for quality evaluation of pork meat products. The nutritional quality is represented by the quality of each processing step in this food chain. This result can be achieved by studying both composition and sensory properties in order to define the food product from the economical point of view. The evaluation of each processing step is important in order to trace the history of the product and can be useful to assess its traceability, according to the UE reg 178/2002, art. 18, which introduces the compulsory commitment. Concerning the consumer's food safety, the aim of the present research is to investigate the traceability along the chain of pork meat products (UNI 11020 and UNI 10939). The procedure that will be developed by elaborating the results of this research will be also useful for the food quality control of protected designations or indications and in all cases where the quality/price ratio is an issue. The heavy pigs will receive different controlled diets. Feed, meat, sausages and hams obtained from these animals will be examined in order to determine conventional routine parameters, sensory properties, volatile compounds, oxidative status, presence of antioxidants and other technology markers. This 'fingerprint' of the products will be the basis for an economic study of the costs of each processing step in the food chain.

OUTRA-ATIVIDADE-TECNICO-CIENTIFICA.ATIVIDADE-REALIZADA: Academic Tutor - Planning, carrying out and evaluating tutorials. Providing a source of academic support. Identifying and monitoring students learning needs

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
Nascent - Marie Curie RTN european project (Post-Doc)
This project will focus on the development and manufacture of molecularly imprinted micro- and nanostructured polymers for selective applications in catalysis, analysis and sensors. The proposed Research Training Network, with its multidisciplinary academic participants involved in molecularly imprinted polymer research from different European countries (including new member countries and institutions from less favoured regions), complemented by three industrial partners, will provide a unique training platform featuring broad expertise, multisectorial environments and international experience. This platform will enable young researchers to acquire a variety of skills, thus allowing them to become 'European' professionals with excellent career perspectives.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Development/Optimization of molecularly imprinted polymer for selective recognition of mycotoxin in food; Validation of the developed method.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Development/Optimization of molecularly imprinted polymer for selective recognition of mycotoxin in food; Validation of the developed method.
